paragraphs.text: Expert: Blacks trust police more than whites do.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Do blacks trust police more than whites do?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Given the anger over events in Ferguson and New York City, the very question seems absurd
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it is not
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Behind the polls and demonstrations, there is evidence that blacks trust police at least as much as whites do
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The poll results are hardly surprising
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A new Gallup poll confirms blacks place less confidence in police and the criminal justice system
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Using survey data from 2006 through 2014, Gallup found 31 percentage points more blacks than whites believe black males are more likely to go to prison than white males primarily because of discrimination(50 percent versus 19 percent)
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: *7 percentage points more blacks believe the honesty and ethics of police are low/very low (17 percent versus 10 percent)
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Similarly
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: , a 2013 Pew Research Centersurvey reveals that 70 percent of blacks believed police treated whites better than blacks
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: By contrast, only 37 percent of whites agreed
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what people say and what they do are often different
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And there are both victims and criminals in black communities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Victims may trust the police for the same reasons that criminals dislike them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Blacks are not a monolithic group: blacks who who have been through the criminal justice system as criminals could answer these questions quite differently than those who have relied on police as victims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The polls don't distinguish between these two groups
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As Charles Barkley recently said:"[Police] are the only thing in the ghetto between this place being the wild, wild west."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Most violent crime victims don't report crimes to police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For example
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: only about half of rapes are reported to police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That has a lot to do with how victims believe they will be treated by the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the case of rape, victims who think that the police are unsympathetic to rape victims or are unlikely to solve the cases are even less likely to report rapes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: black victims really believe police are racist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: why would they report the crime to the police?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Blacks victims don't want other blacks locked up simply due to their race
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they want the criminals who actually committed the crime punished
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Of course people are more likely to report crimes to police if they believe the police will solve them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Why waste time filling out forms and being interviewed if the crime isn't going to be solved?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: blacks think police are incompetent or dishonest or just don't care
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: again there is little reason to turn to the police for help
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: blacks don't shy away from reporting crimes to the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Data compiled by the Bureau of Justice Statisticsfrom 2008 to 2012 shows that blacks are actually more likely than whites to report violent crimes to the police-- 9 percentage points more likely than whites (54 percent to 45 percent)
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Blacks consistently report violent crimes at a higher rate than whites do
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That applies to all income groups as well as for victims living in urban and suburban areas
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This higher rate of reporting is true in areas where blacks face higher violent crime rates than whites and also when the reverse is true
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Bureau of Justice Statistics reports that whites who are below 200 percent of the poverty level face a higher violent crime rate than blacks with the same income
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: blacks still report those crimes at a higher rate
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: For incomes above 200 percent of poverty, blacks are more frequent victims of violent crime
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: again they are still more likely to report them
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: On average, blacks are victims of violent crime at much higher rates than whites
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the gap isn't as large as many people think
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Typically, crime rate comparisons are in terms of the FBI crime data-- data relying on the number of crimes reported to police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we have just noted
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that is misleading
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because blacks report violent crimes at higher rates
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While the FBI crime numbers show blacks to have a 40 percent higher violent crime rate
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: the actual difference is about 30 percent
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: When it comes to crime, the demonstrations and pundits don't reflect how most blacks feel most of the time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There appears to be a silent majority of blacks who trust the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many blacks may get angry about particular cases in the news
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when they have to turn to someone for help, they turn to the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Blacks apparently trust the police to do their job more frequently than whites do
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: John R  Lott, Jr  is a columnist for FoxNews.com
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: He is an economist and was formerly chief economist at the United States Sentencing Commission
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Lott is also a leading expert on guns and op-eds on that issue are done in conjunction with the Crime Prevention Research Center
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: He is the author of eight books including "More Guns, Less Crime."
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: His latest book is"Dumbing Down the Courts: How Politics Keeps the Smartest Judges Off the Bench"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Bascom Hill Publishing Group (September 17, 2013)
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Follow him on Twitter@johnrlottjr
paragraphs.label: no-unit
